abstract: Portland Timbers owner Merritt Paulson purchased soccer club, which is preparing to face Columbus Crew in MLS Cup, with help of father Henry Paulson, former Treasury secretary and former chairman of Goldman Sachs; Timbers are worth $185 million, fourth-highest valuation in league, and had sixth-highest average attendance in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Portland Timbers owner Merritt Paulson bought the club, which will play in the M.L.S. Cup on Sunday, with help from his father, Henry, the former Treasury secretary and a former chairman of Goldman Sachs

headline.main: Owner Guides Timbers to Title Match, With an Assist From His Father
headline.print_headline: Owner Guides Timbers to Title Match, With an Assist From His Father

snippet: The Portland Timbers owner Merritt Paulson bought the club, which will play in the M.L.S. Cup on Sunday, with help from his father, Henry, the former Treasury secretary and a former chairman of Goldman Sachs
